title: Vue v-once Directive

metadata.description: Learn about Vue v-once Directive with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content: Vue Directives Reference Example Using the v-once directive to render an element only once. Run Example » Definition and Usage The v-once directive is used to only render an element once. By only rendering an element once, the performance can be enhanced. When an element has the v-once directive, all its child elements also becomes static after the first render. How often an element gets rendered can also be limited by the v-memo directive to gain performance.
